Data:
==Applies To==

* iOS applications that handle sensitive data.

==What to Check For==

Verify that sensitive data is not logged.

==Why==

If sensitive data is logged, it may be recovered by an attacker if the device is lost or compromised.

==How to Check==

To verify that sensitive data is not logged:

# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of all sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are:
#* Passwords
#* Encryption keys
#* Personal information
# **Review logging code.** Identify code that generates log entries by searching for //NSLog()// function calls. Review this code to verify that it does not include sensitive information in log entries.

==How to Fix==

To prevent logging of sensitive data:

# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of all sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are:
#* Passwords
#* Encryption keys
#* Personal information
# **Review logging code.** Identify code that generates log entries by searching for //NSLog()// function calls. Review this code to verify that it does not include sensitive information in log entries. If necessary, rewrite this code in a way that does not log sensitive data. If //NSLog()// calls are necessary for debugging, they can be commented out in release mode using //#define// directives.

==Privacy Guidelines==
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000001a0c7b|Do Not Cache Sensitive Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000930b93|Do Not Log Location Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000033f0db|Do Not Log Sensitive Data]]

==Privacy Checklists==
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000008cb7d6|Sensitive Data Is Not Cached]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000007e16f2|Location Data Is Not Logged]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000058bf53|Sensitive Data Is Not Logged]]
